New music for September 2015

Written by Brandon King · Published Sep 1, 2015

Anthems for Doomed Youth by The Libertines

Pete, Carl and co. return with their long overdue reunion album (eleven years). The group split in 2004 after the relationship between Doherty and Barat became strained (resulting in the hit Can’t Stand Me Now) but reunited in 2010 for the Reading and Leeds Festivals.

Music complete by New Order

Another band returning after a long break. Music complete is New Order’s first full studio release since 2005’s Waiting For The Siren’s Call. This album also marks a return to the studio for Gillian Gilbert.

Paper Gods by Duran Duran

Duran Duran complete their 14th studio album. For this one they have recruited superstar producers Nile Rodgers and Mark Ronson.

Rattle that lock by David Gilmour

For anyone mourning the final break up of Pink Floyd, here’s some material from their guitarist to keep you going.

Every open eye by Chvrches

More synth pop fronted by the stunning voice of Lauren Mayberry.

We the generation by Rudimental

In case you were thinking we do not have enough dubstep on this list, sometime Ed Sheeran collaborators Rudimental release their second studio album which is the follow up to Home.
